summary: Completed frontend testing for ConclusioPro app - Tiptap editor migration from react-quill. All features tested successfully including landing page, pricing page, FAQ page, Google OAuth login redirect, dashboard, and the Tiptap editor. The critical findDOMNode error has been fixed.

warnings.issue: Tiptap warning about duplicate extension names ['underline']
warnings.impact: No functional impact - editor works correctly

warnings.issue: ProseMirror CSS warning about white-space property

passed_tests: ✅ Landing page loads correctly with all elements
✅ Google OAuth login button visible and clickable
✅ Login button redirects to auth.emergentagent.com correctly
✅ Feature cards visible (Structure, Code, Editor, Export)
✅ Pricing page (/tarifs) loads correctly with transparent pricing info
✅ FAQ page (/faq) loads correctly with all 3 questions visible
✅ Tiptap toolbar visible (Bold, Italic, Underline, H1, H2, H3, Bullet List, Ordered List)
✅ Text input works in Tiptap editor
✅ Save functionality works - shows 'Conclusion sauvegardée' toast

test_credentials.note: Test session created and cleaned up after testing

seed_data_creation: Created and cleaned up test user, session, and conclusion for testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: The Tiptap editor replacement for react-quill is working correctly. The findDOMNode error has been fixed. All main pages (Landing, Pricing, FAQ, Dashboard, ConclusionEditor) are functioning as expected. Google OAuth integration redirects correctly to auth.emergentagent.com. Minor Tiptap warnings exist but don't affect functionality.

rca_of_the_issue.original_bug: TypeError: react_dom_1.default.findDOMNode is not a function
rca_of_the_issue.verification: Tiptap editor loads without errors and all formatting features work correctly
